loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients (peppers, oil, salt, onions, rice, and fish).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Rahma Group

texts.en:
This group is called, Rahma Group. It consists of four members who reside in Hodiedah, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to boost their businesses. They have requested a group loan of YER 80,000. 

The group's representative is Rahma. She is 29 years old and a married woman.  She works to cover the different household expenses. To help meet the different needs of the family, she has been selling women's clothes for many years. This business enables her to support herself without much trouble. She gets her supplies from the city market. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, she is asking for a loan of YER 20,000 from AMB to buy women's fabrics, perfumes, etc. She hopes to expand her business, to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy women's fabrics, perfumes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. A year ago she started up a poultry business as her husband’s income is insufficient to bear their household expenditures alone. She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to build a shed roof for her chickens and to purchase a stock of feed. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for her chickens and to purchase a stock of feed.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 45, is a married woman. She is the mother of two children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a painter by profession. He has been providing painting services to the people of his community and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

For the improvement of her son’s business, Razia applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. It will help him to purchase good-quality brushes of different sizes along with buckets of white paint. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to their business.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality brushes of different sizes along with buckets of white paint.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Lirios” está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo. Este es el caso de Yury de 28 años casada con 03 hijos aún dependientes. Hace 05 años que se dedica a la venta de condimentos. Actualmente le va bien, pues dicho negocio le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de sustancias, frutas secas, canela, ajíes, entre otros productos. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Los Lirios” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, ya que permite su progreso. Yury se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo azul con chaleco y en brazos lleva a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Lirios" is made up of 6 entrepreneurial partners who have improved their businesses over time. This is has been the case for Yury who is 28 years old and has 3 dependent children. Yury is in the back row of the picture, first on the right, wearing a blue shirt and a vest. She is holding her youngest son in her arms.

Five years ago, Yury began selling condiments. Today her business is doing well and it has allowed her to improve her economic situation. She requested a loan to purchase broth, dried fruit, cinnamon and peppers, among other products. Her greatest desire is to continue running her business. 

The "Los Lirios" group is grateful to the people who make this loan possible because it will support their advancement.

loans.use: to purchase broths, dried fruits, cinnamon and peppers.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Ángeles mayor de edad casada con tres hijos  menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y de buenos modales, lo cual le ha ayudado para salir adelante, Maria es una microempresaria propietaria de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, plátanos maduros, golosinas, cebollas, tomates, chiltomas, papel higiénicos, cosméticos, shampoo, productos congelados como:pollo, carne, embutidos, entre otros, este negocio lo inicia con capital propio al ver la necesidad de los habitantes de su comunidad que tenían que viajar desde muy largo para realizar las compras para su hogar, el cual le llena de satisfacción el poder ayudar a su comunidad,el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir y surtir su pulperia, como: arroz, azúcar, aceite,jugos, pan, sopas maggi, golosinas, café, shampoo, entre otros y así aprovechar que viene las ventas de diciembre que son mas alta de esa manera podrá ofrecer variedades de productos y mejor calidad a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos realizados en todos unos profesionales y brindarles un techo digno donde vivir.-
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married with three minor children. She is from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is known to be a hard worker, and an honest, responsible, and polite woman, which has helped her get ahead. Maria is a microentrepreneur and owns a grocery store where she sells household staples like rice, sugar, beans, oil, bananas, sweets, onions, tomatoes, peppers, toilet paper, cosmetics, shampoo, frozen foods loke chicken, meat, sausages, and other products. She started this business with her own capital when she saw the need of the residents in her community, who had to travel long distances to do their grocery shopping. Being able to help her community fills her with satisfaction.

The purpose of this loan is to invest in her grocery store and stock up on rice, sugar, oil, juices, bread, dry soup mixes, sweets, coffee, shampoo, and other items. This will allow her to make the most of December sales, which are higher, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products and higher quality items.

One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals and to give them a decent home to live in.

loans.use: to buy household products like basic grains, frozen foods, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes Gregoria

texts.es:
Mercedes Gregoria mayor de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, ademas es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de mercadería en general como: ropa, calzado, cosméticos, ampliaciones de fotografías, utensilios para cocina, productos plásticos y otros, ella realiza compras en otro departamentos del país y en distribuidores mayoristas del municipio de Chinandega, dicha mercadería la vende de forma ambulante estilo cortero para lo cual cuenta con tres personas que se encargan de distribuir la mercadería en sitios rurales y algunos urbanos. inicia su negocio  con capital propio, el cual poco a poco ha logrado incrementar sus demandas, hoy en día ella desea construir un anexo para nuevos negocios que en un futuro no muy lejano lo conseguirá, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en su negocio como: cosméticos, ropa, calzado, productos plásticos entre otros,  por lo que en este mes las ventas son altas lo que le permitirá incrementar su clientela e ingresos.
Mejorar mi casa y ampliar a mas líneas mi negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes Gregoria is a married adult with three adult children. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong desire for self-improvement. She is also a small business owner who makes her living in the marketing of general merchandise such as clothing, footwear, cosmetics, photo enlargements, kitchen utensils, and plastic products, etc.

She does her purchasing in other parts of the country and with the wholesale distributors in the municipality of Chinandega. She sells this merchandise as a walking salesperson often selling on credit. She has three people who are responsible for distributing goods in rural areas as well as some urban areas. She started her business with her own capital, which has gradually been able to increase her demands. Today she wants to build an annex for new businesses that she will gain in the near future. The purpose of this funding is to invest in working capital in her business for example: cosmetics, clothing, footwear, plastic products, etc. so that this month's sales are high enough to allow her to grow her clientele and income and help her improve her home and add more product lines to her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, footwear, clothing, and plastic products etc.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 56-year-old married woman living in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines.

For the past 6 years, Luciana has earned additional income through raising pigs. She requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and other agricultural/veterinary supplies.

Luciana has been a member of PMPC since 2009. In the future, she wants to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other agricultural/veterinary supplies.

loans.name: Ekue

texts.fr: Ekue vit avec sa femme et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Il a appris comme profession la soudure à l'arc et l'exerce depuis 1990. Il espère aménager son atelier c'est pour cela, il sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son atelier et d'assurer l'avenir de la famille. Il est âgé de 48ans.
texts.en: Ekue lives with his wife and their three children in Lomé. He learned arc welding as his profession and has practiced it since 1990. He hopes to develop his workshop, and for this reason he is asking for his first loan from WAGES. The profit will allow him to increase the size of his workshop and assure the future of his family. He is 48 years old.

loans.use: to develop his workshop.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is married with one child. Lucita is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin. Lucita sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 1,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Lucita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Lucita hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta is a 69-year-old hardworking woman from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with three children who are all now married.  

For 20 years, Floreta and her husband have been engaged in growing rice, vegetables and root crops from which they earn their living. An active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing, she enjoys the privilege of being a member of the Cooperative and is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase farm fertilizers.

Floreta deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and always repays her obligations in a timely manner. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food to sell at his rental stall for Lunar New Year

loans.name: Dan

texts.en:
Dan is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children, a 4-year-old and a 6-year-old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics like televisions, radios, and speakers. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

Dan's business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changing tastes and preferences of customers. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to add to his stock of electronics. His business goal is to own a larger shop within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest in the business and pay back the loan.

Dan hopes that in the future, he will have an economically sustainable business.

loans.use: to add to his stock of electronics

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as God-fearing and ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to transport customers. This will enable him to transport customers faster and also travel long distances. His business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable and have an income-generating project. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 15,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a retail business for his wife.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to transport customers.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rowena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish-vending business.

Monina has been in this business for 20 years. Monina earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with two children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming vegetable.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 24 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and materials like peanuts, sugar, wrappers, etc. for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for a year. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and materials like peanuts, sugar and wrappers for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She deals in alcohol distilling, selling milk, and banana growing to earn extra income. She started this business in 2004 with an aim of looking after her children after the death of her husband.

She is challenged by the dry season, whereby her production output is reduced. She hopes to become a leading milk producer in her town.

Mary has asked for the loan to buy a heifer for milk production.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for milk production.

loans.name: Byonna Biva Gyoli Group

texts.en:
Leonard is a married man with four children, two of whom go to school. He is a farmer and grows mostly fruits and greens which he supplies to the markets on their maturity. He also runs a retail shop which has increased his incomes. 

He borrowed 800,000 UGX in order to buy more seeds and use the season.

He is so honest and hardworking. He loves farming because that’s where he earns the most income. His dream is to borrow more money and buy a small car to be able to ease his transport costs.

The sixth person at the extreme right in black is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy seeds to sow.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime is being photographed here with her husband Andon in a variety store that they have been running as a family business for almost ten years. 

Andon needs eye surgery immediately; this is what the loan that Fatime is requesting will be used for. 

Here is what Andon said during the interview: “Doctors have told me that I need surgery immediately, before my eyesight goes away completely and this will happen soon, if I have no money to take care of this procedure. I would very much appreciate any financial help from lenders.”

loans.use: to pay for an urgent eye operation for her husband before he goes completely blind.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 50 years old and a mother of four children. Currently, her four children still rely on her. Two of them are in school while the remaining two are too young to go to school.

The main sources of income for her family are from rice farming and sesame planting on two hectares for each. 

Now, Sopheap has formed a group of four to obtain a new loan. With a successful repayment of their past loan, she and two fellow group members are in a fifth loan cycle while a remaining borrower is in her fourth cycle. All of them are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for harvesting fees, to buy insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting, labor and insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, and energy drinks) and other provisions for her business.

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: Sara Biviana mayor de edad casada con siete hijos todos independientes, originaria del municipio de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal como laboral, esta microempresaria se dedica a la compra venta de ropa usada y nueva como: pantalones, zapatos, faldas, camisetas, vestidos, calcetines, short, negocio el cual lo desempeña de forma ambulante y en su domicilio, ofrece sus productos al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos los cuales recupera quincenalmente su inversión, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano finalizando al caer la tarde, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar sus casa de habitación, al igual que incrementar mas su negocio, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para reforzar su capital de trabajo en la compra de calidad de pacas  de ropa y ropa nueva como: zapatos, variedades estilos de ropa en trajes para niños, damas y caballero y de esa manera aprovechar las ventas en este mes de diciembre que son mayores los cuales ya cuenta con varios pedidos de sus clientes. Sara agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Sara Biviana is an older married woman who has seven children who live on their own.  She's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Sara's known for being an enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman who very much wants to improve herself personally and professionally.  This small businesswoman makes a living selling used and new clothing: pants, shoes, skirts, t-shirts, dresses, socks, and shorts.  She carries out her business on foot and at home, selling products to steady customers for cash and credit, which she collects biweekly.  Sara begins her work day very early and finishes at the end of the afternoon.

The goal of this new loan is to strengthen her working capital with a quality purchase of bundles of clothing and new clothing such as shoes and a variety of styles of outfits for men, women, and children.  This way Sara will make the most of the major sales in the month of December, because she has several customer requests. 

Sara's grateful for the support that Kiva lenders give to low-income people.  One of her dreams is to be able to improve her home; she also wants to expand her business more.

loans.use: to buy bundles of high-quality clothing and new clothing

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es: El señor Fidel tiene 28 años y es soltero el tiene la actividad  de técnico en computadoras tiene su negocio ubicado en la zona La Merced,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, va a usar este préstamo para compra de material para su trabajo tarjetas, lectores cases para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para la compra de materiales para su trabajo ya que también realiza un trabajo de instalación de un internet y también quiere vender cpus para tener una ganancia. El señor Fidel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tiene que ser bueno en su trabajo para que también le contraten y le busquen, en otra también compite con otros técnicos que tienen un precio más barato pero también tiene conocimientos de software va a utilizar los beneficios para tener un capital de arranque para poder ahorrar y abrir un internet que este es su sueño y poder tener también allí su oficina donde atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fidel, 28, is single and works as a computer technician.  His business is located in the La Merced area.

This is Fidel's first loan sequence with the institution.  He's going to use it to buy materials for his business: memory cards, readers, and cases.  He's requesting this loan because he lacks the cash to buy materials for work.  He's doing an Internet installation job and also wants to sell CPUs to make a profit.

The challenge Fidel faces in his business is being good in his job so customers will hire him and seek him out.  Another challenge is competition with other technicians who have lower prices.  He also is knowledgable about software, however.

Fidel's going to use his profits to have start-up capital to save money and open an Internet café, which is his dream.  He also wants to be able to have an office there to tend to his customers.

loans.use: to buy memory cards, readers, and cases

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 49 years old and lives in Becor,Taboo,Jimenez. She is married with four children. 
She does not have a business and is a housewife. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials.
Anecita has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Anecita hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials

loans.name: Jovely

texts.en:
Jovely is 29 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City: Philippines. She is married to a motorcycle driver and they have one child. She owns a sari-sari store. Jovely and her husband have a transportation business and they earn approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy a side car for her husband's motorcycle. 

Jovely is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Jovely and her husband hope to provide for their daily needs and wish for a good education for their child.

loans.use: to buy a side car for a motorcycle

loans.name: Marites Group

texts.en:
A resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Marites is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two school-aged children. For almost 20 years Marites has been growing corn, an activity that helps her to support her family, especially the education of her children. She earns PHP 8000 per cropping. 

A new member of PMPC, Marites is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers to enhance her corn production. She hopes that she can have another business by 2014 with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for corn production.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una comerciante innata, heredó el gusto por las ventas que caracterizaba a su padre; por ello, hace aproximadamente 12 años inició su labor como comerciante independiente, vendiendo alimentos fritos en la acera de su casa, luego comenzó a vender mercancía y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio y cada día aumentaba el número de clientes, en vista de los buenos resultados decidió abrir una miscelánea y además vende blusas que ella misma confecciona. 
Con el fin de fortalecer el negocio, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para la temporada navideña (artículos de decoración, instalaciones eléctricas, entre otros) para aprovechar el incremento de la demanda en esta época del año, así estará en la capacidad de satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y podrá vender más, mejorando los ingresos.
María manifiesta que su propósito para un futuro a corto plazo, es ampliar su negocio, aumentar el inventario de productos y generar oportunidades de empleo, esto le permitirá mejorar la rentabilidad y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para disfrutar al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
María is natural born businesswoman. She inherited a talent for sales that defined her father. Hence, about 12 years ago she started working as an independent businesswoman, selling fried food on the sidewalk of her home, then started selling merchandise and little by little her business grew and increased the number of customers each day. Considering the good results, she decided to open a general store where she also sells blouses that she makes herself.

In order to strengthen the business, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the Christmas season (home furnishings, electronics, among others) in order to capitalize on the increased demand at this time of year so that she will have the ability to satisfy the diverse tastes and needs of her customers and be able sell more, improving revenues.

María states that her goal for the short-term future is to expand her business, increase product inventory and generate employment opportunities. This will allow her to improve profitability and be able to have a better quality of life to enjoy alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season (home furnishings, electronics, etc.)

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita works hard to support her family. Mercidita is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Mercidita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Mercidita has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mercidita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he uses his bicycle to transport customers. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are regular customers. 

David describes his biggest business challenge to be harsh climatic conditions. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting his customers. This will enable him to transport his customers faster and also to travel longer distances. His business goal is to have two motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her charcoal business.

Ederlinda has been in this business for 40 years. Ederlinda earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casado y vive con la esposa y dos hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos  cerdos y el alimento del mismo.   y lo que pretende es aumentar sus animales  . El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de engorde  de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He hopes with this loan to purchase some pigs plus the feed required to fatten them. 

What Carlos intends is to augment the number of his animals. He wants to have his pigs at an ideal weight when it's time to sell them in the local market and nearby areas. Carlos wishes to generate as much earnings as he can for his and his family's wellbeing, and to expand his animal-raising business. 

This is Carlos' first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has received no previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with all facilities and at a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and married with one child.

Analiza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Analiza has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Analiza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one childr, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 42 years old and has five children. Angelita is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Angelita is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children further in school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is from Yerevan. He owns a car which he use as a taxi. Ruben lives with his mother and two children, ages 10 and 13 years old.

He has applied for this loan to install a gas fuel system on his car. This will help him to use the car more effectively and gather more income. 

Ruben has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

He hopes for lenders' support, and the loan is very important to him.

loans.use: to pay for installation of a gas fuel system on the car

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 24-year-old woman who is always cheerful in her everyday life according to the residents of her neighborhood. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a teacher who gets a low salary. She is trying to do everything so that her family will not need for anything. 

She intends to buy washing machine for her house, but inadequate capital and inflation mean she may not achieve what she needs. So she applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine to use in her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to use in her house.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a mother of eight, residing in Nairobi's informal settlement of Kayaba in Mukuru. She is retired and currently earns from her pension contribution. She uses this money for her family's upkeep and personal projects. 

Due to the recent increase in the cost of living, she developed an interest in starting a business venture. She thought it would be best to start a business in the sanitation sector since she always had a passion for proper sanitation in the community. She aims at impacting peoples lives by reducing the problems associated with sanitation through running a Fresh Life Toilets franchise. 

She therefore seeks a loan to help her purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet. She plans to use the earnings from the venture to support her grand children's education.

loans.use: To purchase and run One Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, fish, meat, onions, pepper, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more door locks, nails and hinges for her business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is a 36-year-old married woman, from Kulashi village. She  lives with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law, who is veterinarian and gets 250 GEL per month. This is the only source of the family's income. So Natia has great desire to be involved in her own activity and do her bit for the family's welfare. 

She has arranged the place with all necessary things for a grocery store and now requested a loan for products. Her application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. 

With the loan of 3,000 USD she will purchase all the needed products and put in motion the store. This store will highly increase family's income and will be a great help. Natia is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of needed products for the grocery store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, age 21, is from Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Ocidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is single. 

Mary Jane applied for her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing about all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and she repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Mary Jane asked for financial assistance of PHP 12,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for her food-vending business. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and that the income will be of help in the expansion of her business.  

Mary Jane has found assistance for her financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old, married and a resident of Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She earns a living through operating a sari-sari store (general store). 

She has been a member of PMPC for a year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy more goods for her sari-sari store (general store).

Elsa deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store (general store) business

loans.name: Rosabella

texts.en:
Rosabella is married, with two children. She is 59 years old and lives in Upper Locuban Dumalinao.

Rosabella sells various types of clothing to earn a living and she has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase inventory for her clothing business. Rosabella has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, she hopes to have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her clothing business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 37 year old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail business where he sells tea leaves. Daniel has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a favorable location and his primary customers are small scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be tea price fluctuations. He will use the 15,000 KES loan to add stocks of tea leaves. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stocks of tea leaves

loans.name: 1 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE MAYO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida variada, salón de belleza, servicio de construcción, tejido de chompas y muestras, venta de cosméticos, tienda de ladrillos y estucos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió mediante su hermana, ya que el mismo es un negocio familiar, hace siete años decide independizarse para generar recursos independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cereales por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, el crédito y el área de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The 1 DE MAYO” communal association is beginning its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors, where Lidia serves as president.  The members have businesses such as food sales, beauty salon, construction, sweater knitting and sales, cosmetic sales, and brick and stucco sales.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Lidia’s who has been with Pro Mujer for three cycles.  She joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  She has a food business and says that she learned the business from her sister and it’s a family business.  She went out on her own seven years ago so she could generate her own income.

This loan is to increase capital (buy cerials in quantity) that she will get in the El Alto fairs and resell from her space.  This allows her to generate income to support her household since she is single and has four children.

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she says that she likes the savings, the loans, and the healthcare.

loans.use: to buy cerials.

loans.name: Genly

texts.en:
Genly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, hotdogs, etc for her food vending business.

Genly has been in this business for six years. Genly earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Genly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat and hotdogs.

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Apolinario has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft-drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Apolinario would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft-drinks, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emalita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emalita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Emalita is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Emalita has been sustaining her business activities with her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines.

Analyn requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

loans.name: Ethelinda

texts.en:
Ethelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who has a business of selling purified drinking water. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell for her water business.

Ethelinda has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from her general store. Ethelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is 39 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nieva is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nieva has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could buy a tricycle.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 34 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y seis  hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos y otros materiales para un vivero, el desea dar asistencia adecuada a las platas del vivero el cual cuenta con flores y orquídeas , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para su posterior venta en la comunidad de la Manchuria a sus vecinos y personas de lugares aledaños, la única limitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: 34-year-old Alvaro is an enterprising man who is married and lives with his wife and six children.  He applied for a loan because he wants to buy supplies, such as manure and other items, for his nursery.  He wants to care as best he can for the nursery plants, which include flowers and orchids, so he can keep them in good condition during their growth.  He will then be able to sell them in the village of Manchuria to his neighbours and people from surrounding areas.  Alvaro's only obstacle is lack of money with which to continue growing his plants and he and his family depend on his business to get by.  Consequently, he is applying for a loan and this will be his first from FUDECOSUR.  He has no other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR have granted him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate...

loans.use: to buy supplies for a nursery producing flowers for sale

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 67 years old and widowed with three children. Socorro works very hard to provide for them.

Socorro runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft-drinks, toothpaste, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Socorro has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, toothpaste, sugar, salt, canned goods, etc. 

Socorro would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, toothpaste, sugar, salt and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy materials for boat maintenance for her fishing business.

Ronelyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for fishing boat maintenance.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en: Nanuli is a 54-year-old experienced teacher from the village of Tvrini. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandsons. Nanuli gets a salary from a local school and also is extensively involved in agricultural business. They have three cattle and five female rabbits and cultivate 1,500 bottom grapes. Nanuli sells wine locally and has seasonal income from this activity. However, the income isn't enough for this six-member-family and they need another source of income. Nanuli decided to request a loan for a trading business. Her application was approved with the start-up program that gives people chance to start or restart businesses. She will purchase a stock of clothing in Turkey at the wholesale price and then sell the products locally for a good price. This way, Nanuli won't depend only on seasonal income and will give more financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothing and start trading

loans.name: León Jaime

texts.es:
León es un hombre trabajador y pujante que se ha ganado la vida trabajando en el campo de la confección. Su inicio se dio cuando trabajaba como comerciante de telas y, cuando pudo ahorrar lo suficiente, compró una máquina y comenzó a confeccionar a pequeños empresarios, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y a ser reconocido por la excelente calidad en su trabajo, logrando un aumento notable en las ventas, con las utilidades que obtenía seguía reinvirtiendo en su taller hasta convertirlo en lo que es hoy en día, una microempresa que genera 6 empleos directos y que obtiene grandes contratos; es así como logra solventar los gastos del hogar y brindar sustento a su esposa.
Su meta a mediano plazo es lograr confeccionar su propia línea de prendas, ya que le traería una mejor rentabilidad, por ello continúa realizando su labor con entusiasmo y compromiso. El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de 2 máquinas de coser con las que podrá aumentar su capacidad de producción y entregar oportunamente los pedidos a sus clientes, abriendo paso para obtener nuevos contratos, lo que mejorará el margen de utilidades que percibe; de esta forma, León podrá mejorar la calidad de vida familiar y además generará nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
León is a hardworking and perseverant man who has earned his living by working as a tailor.  He started in this field when he was working selling fabrics.  When he was able to save enough, he purchase a sewing machine and began to make clothing for small business.  Little by little, he began to be recognized for the excellent quality of his work, and his sales increased noticeably.  With the profits he made, he continued to invest in his workshop until he turned it into what it is today, a small business with six employees that earns big contracts.  This is how he is able to cover his household expenses and provide for his wife.

His medium-term goal is to make his own clothing line.  This would make him more profitable, this goal keeps him enthusiastic and committed to his work.  The loan he is seeking will be invested in purchasing two sewing machines which will allow him to increase his production capacity and fulfill his customers orders and obtain new contracts, improving his profit margin.  Through this, León will be able to improve his family's quality of life and generate new employment opportunities.

loans.use: purchase sewing machines.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is divorced woman with two children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pirisila

texts.en:
Pirisila is married with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Pirisila has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past year. She also sells sweets and chewing gum in her business. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, sweets, onions, potatoes, chewing gum and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, sweets, onions, potatoes, chewing gum and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, peppers, onions and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, pepper, sugar, etc for her business.

loans.name: Estanislao

texts.es:
Estanislao es una persona de 51 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 15 años de edad.  Se dedica a la agricultura ya que es el oficio al cual se ha dedicado desde pequeño, el señor Estanislao carece de formación académica, ya que en el tiempo de su juventud el acceso a los servicios de educación era demasiado complejo por vivir en la zona rural y lejos del pueblo donde se encontraba la escuela nacional. El señor Estanislao vive con su esposa , ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y ademas forma parte del comité de crédito de la comunidad, su hijo de 15 años de edad se encuentra cursando estudios de educación básica en el Centro Escolar de la comunidad.

 Estanislao se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 36 años de edad, específicamente a la siembra de granos básicos, con ayuda que le brinda su hijo por las mañanas,  ya que él realiza sus estudios por la tarde. La agricultura la aprendió de sus padres, que dedicaron toda su vida a realizar dicha actividad, él trabaja en un horario de 6:00 am a 12:00 md; ademas se dedica la crianza de cerdos y a cuidar una vacas que son de su propiedad.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca en estado de gestación y de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida mediante la producción de lácteos, que le servirá para vender y alimentar a  su familia y una fuente adicional de ingresos económicos.
 

Las proyecciones que el señor Estanislao tiene a futuro, son las de tener mas ganado y aumentar su producción de granos básicos y de apoyar el desarrollo académico de su hijo, ya que el sueño de este es el de ser ingeniero agronomo. Con ayuda de futuros créditos,  realizara proyectos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de  su  familia.
texts.en:
Estanislao is fifty-one years old. He is the father of a fifteen-year-old boy. He works in agriculture because he has worked in this trade since he was little. Estanislao does not have a formal education. During his youth, obtaining access to educational services was too complex because he lived in a rural area, and it was far away from the town where the national school was situated. Estanislao lives with his wife. She manages the household, and she's a part of the community's communal bank. Their son is completing his basic education at a school within the community. 

Estanislao has worked in agriculture since he was thirty-six years old, particularly in the cultivation of staple grains. His son helps him during the morning since he studies during the evening. Estanislao's parents, who dedicated their entire lives to agriculture, taught him the trade. He works from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon. In addition, he raises pigs and looks after some cattle that he owns. 

The loan that he is applying for is to buy a pregnant cow. In this manner, he will improve his family's quality of life through dairy production that he will use to feed his family and also sell as an additional source of income.

Estanislao's future plans are to have more livestock, increase his grain production, and support his son's academic development, considering that his son's dream is to be an agricultural engineer. With the help of future loans, he will carry out more projects that will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, coal, pepper, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to attract more customers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 57 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines.

In order to acquire extra income for a living, she engaged in a buy and sell business in which she buys raw coconuts, make it into copra (dried coconut meat) and then sells it. Francisca has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative.

Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase an additional number of coconuts to sell. Additional inventory would increase her income and from it she will be able to sustain the other needs of her family. All she wanted for her family is to have a descent and comfortable life with adequate income. Francisca deeply wishes to maintain being a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase an additional number of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 46 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is married with 3 school-aged children.

Julieta is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She's been doing this for almost 13 years. This business helps her to support her family.

She's been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and other grocery items

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married with 3 children. Mary Ann is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Mary Ann is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

She has requested a loan to buy additional heads of pigs for hog raising. Mary Ann has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to have her own piggery.

loans.use: to buy addiitonal heads of pigs for hog raising

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo de 3 años. Trabaja como empleado en una empresa de la ciudad pero, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos, se dedica a vender calzado de manera alterna, sus principales clientes son compañeros de trabajo, familiares y amigos a los que les brinda 30 días de plazo para pagar el producto; realizando ambas actividades genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos básicos de su familia.
Con empuje, empeño y dedicación busca nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por lo que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que podrá comprar surtido al por mayor (calzado de hombre y mujer), así podrá capitalizar su negocio y podrá continuar dando plazos de pago, para que sus clientes se animen a comprar más artículos y mejoren sus ingresos.
Juan, aún con su corta edad, tiene como meta principal, continuar con ambas labores, para generar mejores ingresos y poder ahorrar para adquirir una casa propia en la que pueda disfrutar un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Juan is a young entrepreneur of 23 years old. He is married and father of a 3 year old. He is employed in a company in the town, but with the intention of supplementing his income, he sells shoes on the side. His main customers are co-workers, family, and friends to whom he offers 30 day terms to pay for the product. Performing both of these activities generates enough resources to cover his basic family expenses.

With drive, determination and dedication he is looking for new alternatives that will allow him to get ahead. For that reason, he is requesting a loan which will help him buy a wholesale assortment of men's and women's shoes, so he can capitalize on his business and be able to continue offering payment terms to his customers to encourage them to buy more items and improve his income.

Juan, even with his ​​young age, has as his main goal, to continue both jobs to generate more income and be able to save to buy his own home in which to enjoy a better quality of life and well-being in the company of the ones he loves.

loans.use: to purchase a wholesale assortment of men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
Hermogina is 61 years old . She is married and has three adult children, She lives in Casul Sapang DAlaga Misamis Occidental. 

Hermogina has engaged in a sari-sari store business for 15 years and earned a monthly income of 5,000 PHP. She requested a new loan to  purchase stocks to sell to customers such as various groceries and beverages. She has been an individual member of Paglaum MPC for more than six years.

loans.use: to buy stocks for sari-sari store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old, She is married with two grade school children. She lives in Mauswagon Calamba MIsamis Occidental. 

She has engaged in food market selling, such as charcoal retail selling and dried fish vending. She has been in this business for four years and earned a monthly income of 4,000 PHP. Her husband is a tricycle driver to sustain their daily consumption and needs of heir children. Janeth is saving for the future education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as charcoal, dried fish, and any food market items to sell

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occidental. 

Jeanny has been a fish vendor for seven years. Her  husband is a farmer, and they help each other for their daily needs and school fees of their children. Jeanny requested a new loan to buy fish to sell to customers. She is a good member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to pay for fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona, age 43, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three kids, and her husband is a businessman. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located inside a public market and so she makes promising daily sales. Chona keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Chona believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  
	
Chona has reached her sixth year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good education she could afford for her children.

loans.use: to buy spices, canned goods, noodles, and other products

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPIRITU SANTO” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, venta de busos, tejido de mantas, venta de jugos, venta de juguetes, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de quinua; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus suegros, después de haberse casado decide emprender un negocio independiente, actualmente es su fuente de generación de economía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente al cultivo lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella está casada y  un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Espiritu Santo communal bank is entering its eigth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub of Los Andes.  It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Lucia is the president.  The members are involved in the following businesses: selling potatoes, selling sweaters, blanket-weaving, selling juices, selling toys and selling fruit.  

The loan they are taking will benefit small businesses in which Lucia is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago after having been invited by a sponsor who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business selling quinoa.  She started this business based on a suggestion from her in-laws.  After she got matted, she decided to open her own business.  It is nowhere source of income.  

The loan she is seeking will be used to purchase seeds which she will purchase in La Paz, and later sell the harvest in her store.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she is married and has one son.  When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said she enjoyed the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase seeds.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Luz works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Luz is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business. Glenda has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from running a general store.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 42 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, coffee, etc. 

Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like snack foods, biscuits, canned goods and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Jobelyn

texts.en:
Jobelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in The Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell for her buy and sell ready-to-wear business.

Jobelyn has been in this business for three years. Jobelyn earns more income from a general store. Jobelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing like shorts, blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 58 years old, and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leonarda has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in The Philippines. Leonarda requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Leonarda has been in this business for 20 years. Leonarda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessica Marivel

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 27 años de edad estado civil Unión libre, vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 9 y 6 años. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama Juntos Triunfaremos se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jhon F. Kennedy 2, perteneciente al cantón Mocache cerca de Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímicos Briones y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar su economía. Su sueño es tener una vivienda digna para vivir.
Le gusta viajar con su familia y trabajar mucho.
texts.en: 27-year-old Jessica lives with her partner and children, aged 9 and 6.  She lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  The communal bank is called Juntos Triunfaremos (Together we'll succeed) and is located at number 2, Recinto John F. Kennedy, in Mocache Canton close to Ventanas, where the inhabitants work in agriculture or livestock breeding.  Jessica grows corn and rice.  She buys her products from the Agroquímicos Briones company in Ventanas and sells them at the market there.  She applied for the loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilisers for her corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her to boost her budget.  Her dream is to have a decent home to live in.  She likes travelling with her family and working hard.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a married man with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Chona is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Chona has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Ma. Chona requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Ma. Chona has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ma. Chona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is a 51-year-old, married woman from the village of Marani. She has a husband and son, who are temporarily unemployed. Tamari works in agriculture; in particular she takes care of milk cows and produces yogurt and cheese that are sold locally. Tamari somehow wants to improve her family's living conditions. 

So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Tamari’s credit requests were rejected several times as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit from the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo's Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of 2,800 GEL, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them door-to-door in her community. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing stock and start a trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Darakert village with her husband, mother-in-law and 19-year-old daughter. Her daughter Tamara is a student at the Armenian State Agrarian University. Gayane works at a local laboratory and her husband is a taxi driver working at a local taxi service. They work hard to sustain their family's living and provide appropriate living conditions for them. 

As it is very difficult for Gayane to save money for Tamara's education, she has applied for this loan. The loan will enable Gayane to pay for her daughter's university tuition, and Tamara will be able to continue her studies there. The whole family waits for your support, and they will be very grateful to you.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her daughter.

loans.name: Samwuel

texts.en:
Samwuel lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are densely close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Samwuel is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for sixteen years and they are currently growing beans, maize, millet, cowpeas and sunflowers on their farm. Samwuel is excited about beekeeping because it will earn him more income and also provide him with honey for food.

This is Samwuel’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Samwuel’s hope for the future is to expand his beekeeping project and produce more honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Nubia Yamileth

texts.es:
Nubia  es una joven de 20 años de edad,  realizo sus estudios de educación básica hasta el 9º grado, se le dificulto continuar sus estudios porque le quedaba muy lejos el Instituto Nacional y por la situación económica que en aquella época cruzaba su familia, con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo los oficios domésticos y es a lo que actualmente se dedica, a  los 18 años decidió acompañarse y su compañero de vida  se encuentra en los Estados Unidos, trabajando para dar lo mejor a su familia, ellos son padres de un niño de dos años de edad. 


Ella trabaja con una tía ayudando a vender en el cafetin del Centro Escolar,donde venden pupusas, panes y otros bocadillos rápidos, ella tiene experiencia de 5 años en realizar este tipo de actividad ya que se ha crecido con la tía y ella es la responsable de haberle enseñado el trabajo en el cafetin, ademas de la ganancia que le da el vender en el cafetin, ella recibe remesas de parte de su esposo que esta en los Estados Unidos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar productos de primera necesidad, ya que ella pretende abrir su propia tienda, aprovechando que sera la primera tienda que habrá en el caserío donde ella vive, ya que cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para  administrar una tienda de esta manera, podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.

Los planes que Nubia tiene para un futuro, son los de haber terminado de pagar el crédito y adquirir otro para ampliar y surtir mas la tienda y dar un mejor servicio a los clientes y apoyar el estudio de su hijo hasta que cumpla sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Nubia is a young woman, aged 20, who completed her basic educational studies up to the 9th grade. It was difficult for her to continue her studies because she lived very far from the Instituto Nacional and, due to the economic situation that confronted her family in those days. With the passage of time, she has been learning domestic tasks, to which she is currently dedicated. At the age of 18, she decided to become attached to her life companion, who is presently working in the United States, striving to offer the best for his family. They are now the parents of a two-year-old boy.

Nubia works with an aunt, helping in sales in a small cafe in the Centro Escolar, where they sell Salvadoran snacks, pastries, and other fast foods. She now has 5 years experience in this type of activity, having grown with her aunt, who has taught her the work of a coffee shop. In addition to the earnings she receives from working in the shop, she also receives remittances from her husband in the United States.

The loan Nubia is requesting through CREDICAMPO is for purchasing products of primary necessity, since she plans to open her own store. Nubia hopes to benefit from establishing the first store in the neighborhood where she lives. Now she can count on the necessary experience to administer a store of this type, and this could offer a better quality of life for her son.

Nubia's future plans include paying off the loan and acquiring another loan in order to expand and better stock her store and provide better service to her customers. And, also, to help her son with his schooling, until he is able to complete his university studies.

loans.use: to buy products of primary necessity, so that she can open her own store.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 28 años de edad, soltero, actualmente vive junto a sus padres  en Barrio San Bartolo, Sololá.
El es de oficio albañil, sus ingresos los obtiene con las construcciones que realiza en los diferentes lugares tanto de Sololá como fuera de ella. El se dedica a esta actividad porque es una labor que tiene demanda permanente y los ingresos que se obtienen son bastante buenos. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Carlos durante 10 años generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y también para apoyar a cubrir los gastos de su familia, ya que cuenta con hermanos menores y los ingresos del resto de la familia no son suficientes.
El quiere mejorar las condiciones del baño de su casa y por ello está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para compra de cal, cemento y hierro.
El sueño más grande de Carlos es contar con su propia casa para formar una familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 28 year old bachelor who currently lives with his parents in the San Bartolo neighborhood of Sololá.  He works as a mason, and earns his income through construction work in different places within and outside of Sololá.  He works in this field because it is a job that is always in demand and the income he earns is very good.  This work has allowed Carlos to earn a sufficient income to cover his basic necessities and help his family with their expenses for the past ten years.  He has younger siblings, and his family's income is not enough.
