This is the only source of income in the family. Mustafa studies English Literature and he would like to finish his studies to find a job and help his family for part of the family expenses. Mustafa dreams of taking a higher degree in the future.

Mustafa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mustafa will be able to do his home works and write the reports easily. 

Mustafa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 61 años y está Casado con la señora Catalina quien tiene 56 años ambos oriundos de la ciudad de Caacupé, ambos tienen hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes.
El señor José tiene una despensa copetín el que está instalado en su propia casa, ayudado por su esposa, y de esa forma ambos luchan por seguir trabajando. Es una pareja que se esfuerza mucho por poder seguir con su trabajo y mantener sus gastos del día a día.
José solicita el crédito para la compra de golosinas alusivas a  las fiestas de fin de año, así tendrá todo tipo para ofrecer a su clientela. El agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old and is married to Catalina, who is 56. They are both from the city of Caacupé and have adult children who live on their own. 

José has a small store in his home which he runs with his wife's help. It allows them to keep working. They are a couple who strive to keep their business going and cover their daily expenses. 

José is requesting this loan to buy holiday sweets for New Year's Eve. This will allow him to have all different kinds to offer his customers. He is grateful for this opportunity to keep working.

loans.use: to buy holiday sweets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installment for this semester.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra  tiene  26 años, es soltera  y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Ella es hija de una pareja que toda la vida se dedicó a la fabricación y ventas de artesanías, tales como la hamacas, frazadas y manteles bordados, ella para no quedarse atrás empezó a ayudar ya que sus hermanos también se dedicaban a eso. Hoy en día ya lleva sus productos para la venta por Argentina y así está ganándose el sustento para su familia. Es una persona muy activa, que trabaja y se esfuerza por ir mejorando su vid ay también poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de más sabanas e hilo para la fabricación de hamacas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old,single, and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is the daughter of a couple who spent their entire lives making and selling handicrafts such as embroidered hammocks, blankets, and tablecloths. Not wanting to be left behind, she began to help, along with her siblings who also did this work. 

Currently she goes to Argentina to sell her products and earns enough money to sustain her family. She is a very active person who works hard and really tries to improve her life and help her family.  she is asking for the loan so she can buy more sheets and thread to make hammocks.

loans.use: to buy sheets and thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria viene de una familia muy humilde, que es muy trabajadora y que siempre fue un ejemplo para ella y que son su inspiración.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, por medio del cual podrá ayudar a las personas que necesitan atención en su salud y lo cual siempre ha sido su sueño.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Gloria is from a  humble, hard-working family which has always been an example for her and an inspiration. She is studying nursing which will allow her to help people who need health care.  This has always been her dream. She is asking for this loan so she can pay her tuition and be able to continue to study and reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Moyad

texts.en:
Moyad is a 33-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his wife in a small simple house in the city. Since Moyad was a young man, he has been working on the family land where they plant olive trees. They sell olives and olive oil to the local traders. It is a good business but seasonal. 

Moyad took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more olive seedlings for his farm. By taking out this loan, Moyad's business will be improved and his income will be increased. Moyad appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings  for his farm.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es una persona luchadora, ya que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo para poder cubrir una parte de sus estudios y también colaborar en su casa con los gastos.
Claudia está muy esperanzada de que por medio de su esfuerzo podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, ya que quiere ser una profesional exitosa que sea útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también poder cubrir sus cuotas. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad de seguir estudiando que le da kiva.
texts.en: Claudia is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is a fighter as she both studies and works at the same time in order to cover part of her studies and also contribute to the household expenses. Claudia is very encouraged that through her studies she can improve her and her family's standard of living. She is studying Business Administration as she wants to be a successful profession who is useful to her community. She is requesting a loan to be able to pay for her tuition and fees for her university classes. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue studying that Kiva is giving her.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees for her classes at university.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 21-year-old single man. He describes himself as a person with potential. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local customers.

Simon describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to have a more profitable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be more competitive and will create employment.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en:
Bethy is a 30-year-old woman who has four children. She describes herself as experienced. For the past seven years, Bethy has operated a retail business where she sells socks, wallets, jewellery and other accessories. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital.

Bethy will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of wallets, socks, jewellery, etc. Her business goal is to be sustainable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of wallets, socks, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 37-year-old married woman who has six children. She describes herself as an honest person. For the past seven years, Susan has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 21-year-old married man. He describes himself as a man of the people. He operates a transport business, where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years now. His business is located in a sub-urban area and his primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pay for motorcycle insurance. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will help to boost the economy. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back this loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike and pay for motorcycle insurance

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as a committed person. She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables. Nelius has been involved in this business for 6 years now. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are individuals and hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low season which affects her sales. Nelius will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stocks of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to be able to export her produce within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to add stocks of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a 20-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She engages in selling various clothing goods and footwear apparel. Her business started more than 2 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various stocks of footwear like slippers and clothing like skirts, pants and whole dresses. This will be very helpful in attracting her customers, and at the same time, she could cater to her customers needs on time, creating an increase in sales and generated income. In the future, Deborah hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy various stocks of footwear like slippers and clothing like skirts, pants and whole dresses

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is married with 2 school-aged children. She operates a cellphone reloading business. She sells loads like Smart, Touch mobile, Talk n Text and Globe subscribers. Her business started more than a year ago now. She is asking for a loan to buy more cellphone units and to pay for her children's school fees. This is very essential in making her loading business prosper and also to provide her children with good living conditions. In the future, Leonora would like to expand her electronic loading business and increase her business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy  more cellphone units and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 41 years old, married and has three children ages 8, 9, and 11 years old. She lives in Cortes, Bohol with her family. Zenaida operates a small restaurant, locally known as "carenderia", in the neighborhood for 11 years now. She sells different home-cooked viands made of vegetables, fish and meat. Her husband also helps in the business. She is asking for a loan to buy pork, rice, soy sauce, cooking oil and spices. With the loan, she will be able to finance her business while also meeting the needs of her children such as school fees and food for her family. In the future, Zenaida hopes to have a bigger restaurant for the people in her community and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pork, rice, soy sauce, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 22-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will create employment for others.

loans.use: to buy stocks of drinks, sugar, bread, cakes, maize flour, and other items

loans.name: Alexander Joel

texts.es: Alexander, tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive en casa familiar. Es un joven muy trabajador y responsable. Actualmente trabaja como ayudante en una panadería, elaborando pasteles, biscochos y otros. Beneficiario solicita crédito para remodelación y construcción de su cuarto para el cual necesita comprar: ladrillos, cemento, pintura y otros para tener mayor seguridad e independencia. Su sueño es comprarse su casa propia
texts.en: Alexander is twenty-one years old. He in single and lives with his parents. He is a very hardworking and responsible young man. He currently works as an assistant at a bakery, making cakes, sponge cake, and other items. He is applying for this loan to build and remodel his room for which he will need to buy bricks, cement, paint, and other items, in order to have more independence and security. His dream is to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, paint, and other items to build and remodel his room.

loans.name: Sory's Group

texts.en:
Sory is a 50-year-old mother of two kids. She is a villager from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.

To earn a living, she raises pigs. She earns additional income by working for others for a fee. Her five years in the pig-raising business has enabled her to earn up to 34,000 KHR per day.

This is Sory's first loan request through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan in order to buy a plot of farmland, pigs, as well as pig feed. She hopes that she can generate solid income from her business as a result of the requested loan.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing a plot of farmland, pigs, and feed

loans.name: Each

texts.en:
Each is a 43-year-old mother of five children. She is from the Kang Meas district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia.

To earn a livng, she works as a farmer. For 30 years, she has also been raising piglets as a second source of income. She typically earns approximately $5.02 per day from her business activities, which usually enables her to support her family.

But now she has insufficient funds to pay for her son's education. So, she decided to apply for a new loan from VisionFund to pay for her son's school fees because he wants to finish his accounting coursework. She hopes that her son will get a new job after he graduates from school.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Aquilina: Es una mujer emprendedora, amable y luchadora, con dos hijos en edad escolar; es originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Desde hace 20 años estableció en su vivienda el negocio de ropa usada para hombres y mujeres, también tiene un salón de belleza, que lo inició con capital propio. Gracias a los ingresos de sus negocios es una mujer independiente que está educando a sus hijos con sus propios esfuerzos. Aún permanece en su memoria las etapas iniciales de su negocio, que alquilaba el espejo y algunos accesorios. Poco a poco ha venido creciendo y actualmente cuenta con un personal de 5 personas que trabajan con ella en el salón de belleza. Hace dos años comenzó también con el negocio de ropa usada en el mercado de Bilwi en el cual también ha dado trabajo a una muchacha que le ayuda atender a los clientes. Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar una paca de pantalón para hombres, una paca de camisa manga larga y mixtas para hombres, una paca de faldas, capri y blusas. Los productos los compra en Managua, para ofertarlo a precios accesibles en Bilwi. Su sueño es remodelar el local del salón de belleza, equiparlo con una secadora y plancha de cabello, ofertar productos de belleza y construir con cerámica el piso de su vivienda que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Aquilina is an enterprising, kind, and determined woman with 2 school-age children. She is from Puerto Cabazas. Some 20 years ago, Aquilina established in her home a used-clothing business for men and women. She also has a beauty salon which she launched with her own capital. 

Thanks to the income from her businesses, Aquilina is an independent woman who is educating her children through her own efforts. She still remembers the first stages of her business, when she rented the mirror and some accessories. Little by little, her business has been growing and at present, she can count on 5 workers who help her in the beauty salon.

Some 2 years ago, Aquilina also started a used clothing business in the Bilwi market, and she has hired a girl who helps her attend to customers there.

Now she is soliciting financing to purchase a bundle of men's pants, another of long-sleeved shirts and men's mixed clothing, and a bundle of skirts, capri pants, and blouses. She is buying these products in Managua to offer at accessible prices in Bilwi.

Aquilina's dream is to remodel the location of her beauty salon, and to purchase a hair drier and a hair iron, and to offer beauty products for sale. Also, to construct a tile floor for her home, which is presently made of earth.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of men's pants, and a bundle of long-sleeved shirts, and another of mixed men's clothing, plus a bundle of skirts, capri pants and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 48-year-old mother of four. For several years, she had a small at-home daycare for pre-kindergarten kids. After the children in her neighborhood have grown, there was no need for daycare services. Mona completed a sewing and tailoring course with success and is now using her business knowledge to open a new business activity. Mona creates bridal wear and provides tailoring services. She needs this loan to assist her in purchasing a sewing machine, beading, materials, cloth, shelving and hanging arrangements for dresses. Mona knows she can make her business a success. There is much demand in her area and she will be providing quality services. Right now, she is concentrating on organizing the area for her business and wants to continue so that one day, she will be able to expand into a larger store.

loans.use: to assist in purchasing a sewing machine, beading, materials, cloth, shelving and hanging arrangement for dresses.

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en: Ceciliah is a 49-year-old married woman. She has 3 children from ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years old. She describes herself as an enterprising person. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 27 years now. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of bananas. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stocks of bananas. Her business goal is to be a supplier of bananas within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of bananas

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 2 children who are ages 5 years and 13 years old. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits and drinks. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a gas cooker that which will benefit four family members. They will be able to cook efficiently in their house. They face the challenge of unreliable sources for cooking fuel. She hopes that in the future, she will live comfortably. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Damas Trabajadoras es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Asunción, por mujeres muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, es por eso que lleva ese nombre este grupo. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el que quieren conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a eso poder seguir trabajando.
 Una persona a destacar es  Sebastiana, quien vende frutas y verduras de estación, su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que sus ventas las hace de manera ambulante, y así se gana el día a día. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda grande donde poder ofrecer sus productos y también seguir trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia. Pide de este préstamo ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras frescas, para poder seguir sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Damas Trabajadoras" communal bank is located in the city of Asunción. It is made up of woman who are very demanding and hard-working, which is why the group wears this name (working women). They have participated in the Poverty Stoplight survey, so they can understand all their situations and from this continue working. 

One member who stands out is Sebastiana, who sells fruit and vegetables. Her work is very demanding as she sells door to door and each day earns her living in this way. Her dream is to own a large store where she can offer her products and continue working to help her family. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fresh fruit and vegetables to continue her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en: Tecla is a 53-year-old single woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for two years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will enable them to cut fuel costs in their house. She hopes that in the future she will excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy  a solar lamp

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 20-year-old single young man from Jenin City. He lives with his family in a simple house. Ibrahim and his father work on their agricultural land where they plant olive trees. It is a good business but with a seasonal income. 

Ibrahim has a health problem and he needs stomach surgery. Ibrahim took out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for the stomach surgery. By taking out this loan, Ibrahim will be able to go back to work and do all his daily activities. Ibrahim appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for his stomach surgery

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a determined person.

To earn a living, she operates a tailoring shop, where she makes dresses. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.

She would like to use the proceeds from the requested 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric, threads, and other materials for making dresses. Her business goal is to reach a wider market within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., fabric and threads) to make more dresses

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 5 and 9 years old. She describes herself as determined.

To earn a living, she operates a food café, where she cooks food to sell to her customers. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of space.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, vegetables and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This would be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional cooking oil, wheat flour, vegetables and other ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Jaen

texts.en: Jaen is a married woman. She has 2 children whom are 15 years and 30 years old. She describes herself as a visionary person. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She will use the Kes 5,500 loan to buy a gas cooker for use at her house.This will benefit four family members. They will be able to cook efficiently in their house. They face the challenge of unreliable energy sources. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 26 years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She will use the Kes 15000 loan to buy a gas cooker which will benefit five family members. They will be able to cook efficiently in their house. They face a challenge of unreliable energy sources. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 55-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 30 years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows crops. Stephen will use the Kes 5500 loan to buy a gas cooker which will benefit five family members. They will be able to cook efficiently in their house. They face a challenge of unreliable energy sources. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 47-year-old man. He has five children with ages ranging from 17 years to 21 years. He operates a retail business where he sells milk to earn a living. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light his house. This will enable his family to have a reliable and cheap source of lighting in their house. He hopes that in the future he will succeed in his business.

loans.use: to buy  a solar lamp

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a 40-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 4 years to 18 years. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking oil, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will benefit eight family members. She hopes that in the future she will succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy  a solar lamp

loans.name: Ebby

texts.en: Ebby is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will benefit five family members. This will enable them to cut fuel costs and have a reliable source of lighting. She hopes that in the future she will succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy  a solar lamp

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a 61-year-old woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 18 years to 36 years. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will benefit six family members. She hopes that in the future she will succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sink and hairdressing tools

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 44-year-old single woman. She has four children. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food. She has been involved in this business for two years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will benefit five family members. They will be able to access a cheap and reliable source of light. She hopes that in the future she will succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. She will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp to light her house. This will benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future she will succeed in her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is a 41-year-old married woman from Kandal province. She and her husband have three kids, who are all in school.

She covers her family's daily costs of living with her pig-raising and grocery sales businesses. Her husband runs a motor-taxi business to provide additional income for their family.

Neang is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her prior loan, which she completely repaid, enabled her to improve her family's living conditions. Now she is applying for a new loan to pay for her son's school fees because he is studying electronic engineering. She hopes to keep her son in university until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school (electronic engineering) fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her business

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Because Noor is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Noor was born in 1991. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a teacher.

Noor has been selling accessories and perfumes at home for 1 year. She started her project selling a small amount of her products. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of accessories and perfumes to raise her profits and sales, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Naeema

texts.en:
Because Naeema is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Naeema was born in 1971. She is a married lady living in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat with her husband and 5 sons and daughters. Her husband is a cement mixer.

Naeema has been supporting her husband financially with her project of selling cosmetic products and perfumes for 1 year after she noticed that his job is a weak source of income. She started it by selling a small quantity of items. Now she wants to expand by buying a larger quantity in order to raise her profit and income, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes and cosmetic products  for her business

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud was born in 1986.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is in the military.

Kholoud has been selling blankets for 1 year. She considered her work to be a good source of income to support her husband in improving their living conditions. Now Kholoud would like to raise the amount of blankets she sells in order to raise her profit and income, but unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she had applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business

loans.name: Zeriddah

texts.en:
Zeriddah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. The child attends school. She is not looking after any other family members.

Zeriddah has been operating a salon for the last five years, working seven days a week. She also sells cosmetics, weaves, braids, and crafts to supplement her income.

Zeriddah has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock wigs, braids, and hair oils. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to open another branch. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on the loans. She stays in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more hair oils, braids, and wigs.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 32 years old and married, with three children.

Sharon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Sharon has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and she earns additional income from raising pigs.

Sharon aspires to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 44 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Emelda has a basket-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her basket-making business.

Emelda has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her basket-making business.

loans.name: Viacine

texts.en: Viacine is 30 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past thirteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more onions and tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Yulanda

texts.en:
Yulanda works hard to support her family. Yulanda is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Yulanda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell.

Yulanda has been in this business for three years now.

Yulanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing like shorts, t-shirts, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Annonciatte

texts.en: Annonciatte is 48-years-old. She sells various foodstuffs such as bananas, rice, and cassava and she sells drinks especially soft drinks, like sodas.  She has been in the business for the past fifteen years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, bananas and soft drinks for resale.  The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Bunjojo Sacco Group

texts.en:
Joshua is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in a farming business for both home and commercial purposes. He started this business so he could educate his children. His challenge is limited capital and seasonal changes, especially the dry season. Joshua's dream is to see his children go through university.

Joshua has asked for a loan to weed his gardens. He is a member of the Bunjojo SACCO group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan.

loans.use: to weed his gardens.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 26 years old. He is a farmer and works 8 hours a day. He began his farming business to sustain his family. His customers are people in the marketplace. Paul hopes to expand his agricultural products. He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers. Paul's challenge is climate change which sometimes affects his production (either heavy rains or sunshine). He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a second-time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, now applying for a school fees loan of UGX 500,000. She is a single mother of three children whom she has always taken care of, using income from a small shop she operates from her home on the outskirts of the city. She has always worked tirelessly in order to educate and feed her children, as well as paying rent for the house they stay in and the shop. 

Irene's major challenge is meeting the school dues for her children and, to have this partially solved, she has always borrowed small school loans that her business services with ease.

Irene’s future plan is to see her children grow well and to educate them through good schools.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 39-year-old woman. She has two children with ages four and nine. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She will use the 5,800Kes loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house. This will enable her family cut fuel costs and save some money for other uses. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 35-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and married. She has five children, with ages ranging from 20 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tea leaves. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage tank. This will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. 

Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that she will have a brighter future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water storage tank for home use

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a ticketing outlet business in the Philippines, and she also earns income as a tour and travel agent. 

Cheryl is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional computers and pay for laborers' salaries for her ticketing outlet business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computers and pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 67 years old and a widow. She has five children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 17,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, groceries, etc.

Nelia has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling vegetables and bananas.

Nelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store.

Haydee has been in this business for five years. Haydee earns more income from selling dried fish and rice.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and only one of them attends school. She is not looking after other family members.  She has been selling textiles in a retail shop for the last two years, working six days a week. She is also a tailor.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more cloth to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to accumulate profits to enable her to expand to her own shop. She joined MCDT because she did not have the capital for dealing in new cloth. She stays in her house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Analy is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Analy has been in pig fattening for 1 year now and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yoneki

texts.en:
Yoneki is a 32-year-old married woman with 3 children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has been in a fresh food business since 2006.  Despite being in this business for all these years, she has had hardships like the perishability of her products and seasonal changes.  These have caused her income to be reduced. However, she dreams of getting a refrigerator to keep her products good for some time and also of building a permanent house.

Yoneki has requested for a loan to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to construct a permanent house

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is 53 years old and married with five children.

Aquilina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Aquilina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a 58-year-old married woman with 12 children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has been concentrating on a farming business for 25 years. Despite her progress over these years, she is challenged by limited capital and pests and diseases that affect her tomatoes. She has a dream of educating her children.

Angella intends to use the loan to buy herbicides to spray her gardens.

loans.use: to buy herbicides to spray her gardens

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She owns a pub that she started in 2008 as additional income alongside teaching. She ventured into this business so as to improve on her economic status. She is affected by high prices of drinks and the time limit on drinking up to 10:00 as people want to extend to later hours. Her dream is to have a big bar and a healthy family.

Margret has asked for a loan to buy drinks for the bar to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks for the bar to sell

loans.name: Sydney

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, two of whom attend school, Sydney works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a boarding house. Sydney is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc. for her restaurant.

Sydney has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like fish, meat, spices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for years now and works hard to support her family.

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to process to dried fish.

In the future, Merly would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to process to dried fish.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling chicken.  Angelita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional meat and other food to sell through her food-vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional meat and other food to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, a sus 68 años de edad y luego de haber trabajado arduamente para sacar a su familia adelante; sigue con energías para seguir trabajando; actualmente se dedica a vender frutas caramelizadas de manera ambulante, esta actividad surgió hace 6 años, por la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar los gastos propios y de su esposa, pues ya sus dos hijos viven a parte con sus nuevas familias; trabaja todos los días por las diferentes calles de la ciudad y su perseverancia y empeño lo impulsan a buscar siempre nuevas alternativas para seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar materia prima al por mayor (frutas, azúcar, empaques, palos de madera, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de fin de año, especialmente por la gran afluencia de habitantes y extranjeros que llegan a la ciudad a ver los espectáculos navideños que se realizan por esta época, así logra mejorar los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Guillermo manifiesta que su edad no le impide trabajar y mucho menos soñar, pues desea seguir luchando para llegar a cumplir el anhelo de tener un local propio en el que pueda distribuir todo tipo de dulces y que éste le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida, merecida por su ardua labor durante todos estos años de esfuerzos realizados.
texts.en:
At 68 years old and after having worked arduously to help his family get ahead, Guillermo continues to work energetically. Currently he sells candied fruit door-to-door. He started his business six years ago out of the necessity to generate income to cover his and his wife's expenses.  His two children live on their own with their new families.  

He works every day throughout the streets of the city, and his determination and effort push him to always look for new ways to continue to advance. This is why he is requesting the support of this loan with which he would like to buy raw materials at wholesale (fruit, sugar, packaging, wooden sticks, etc.). This will allow him to stock up so he can meet the increased demand of the holiday season, especially the large influx of residents and foreigners who come to the city to see the Christmas shows at this time of year. In this way he will be able to increase the income he takes home. 

Guillermo states that his age does prevent him from working, much less dream. He wants to keep fighting so that one day he will fulfill his wish of having his own store from which he can sell all kinds of sweets. This will guarantee him financial stability and allow him to enjoy a better quality of life with his wife, something he deserves after all these years of such hard work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale (fruit, sugar, packaging, wooden sticks, etc.)

loans.name: Kevin Alejandro

texts.es:
Kevin es un joven emprendedor y enérgico, a sus 18 años de edad ya posee su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de refrescante guarapo de caña que inició con unos ahorros que tenía de su anterior empleo, con el ánimo de generar ingresos por cuenta propia y motivado por un amigo comenzó a vender el producto a las afueras de su casa, que está ubicada en una zona privilegiada por la gran afluencia de personas que transitan por allí, pues es una vía principal del barrio donde reside; esto le ha permitido generar recursos para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita su primer ciclo de crédito con el que desea comprar materia prima e insumos al por mayor (caña, vasos y pitillos desechables) y una alfombra plástica para poner el motor y las canecas plásticas, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio y además tendrá suficientes insumos para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa notablemente en la temporada de fin de año, dando como resultado un mayor nivel de ingresos para la familia.
Kevin, con su espíritu emprendedor y su proyección hacia el futuro, desea seguir trabajando en la acreditación y fortalecimiento de su negocio, para que sea más rentable y le permita seguir apoyando a su familia con los gastos del hogar, además quiere brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Kevin is a young and energetic entrepreneur. At 18 years old he already had his own business, which was a stall selling refreshing sugar-cane juice and began with some savings that he had from a previous job. With the aim of generating a self-employed income, and motivated by a friend, he began to sell his product outside his home, which is located in a privileged area due to the large influx of people moving around. He lives on the main thoroughfare of his area and this has enabled him to generate income to support his family's household expenses.

He is now requesting his first loan cycle with which he wants to buy raw materials and wholesale stock (e.g. cane, cups, disposable straws) and a plastic cover on which to put the motor and plastic containers. This will enable him to improve the business image and, in addition, have sufficient supplies to meet demand, which increases significantly, at the end of the year, resulting in a higher level of income for the family.

Kevin, with his entrepreneurial spirit, and his future focus, wants to continue working on the credentials and strengthening of his business, in order that it may become more profitable, allowing him to continue to support his family with household expenses, as well as providing a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and wholesale stock (e.g. cane, cups, disposable straws) and a plastic cover on which to put the motor and plastic containers.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Basilisa has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

Basilisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Don Santos es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado. Tiene 36 años de edad. De oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con fondos propios y con la ayuda de su esposa ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Gaseosas, Carnes, Pollo, Lácteos, Arroz, Recargas celulares etc. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ampliar la capacidad de oferta de sus productos y podrá incrementar su clientela. Su plan futuro es que el negocio crezca y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Santos is a native of the city of Estelí. He is thirty-six years old and married. As a retailer, he runs a local convenience store. He opened his business with his own capital, and with the help of his wife, it has been steadily growing. He is applying for this loan to buy soft drinks, meat, chicken, dairy products, rice, and cell phone refill cards. He expects that this loan will greatly help him to increase his product variety and customer base. His future plan is to grow his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, chicken, dairy products, rice, and cell phone refill cards.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 23 years old and married with one child. Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, snack foods, candies, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell like eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell like eggs, milk, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 29 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. Glenda works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a business buying and and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Glenda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. One of her children is in school.

Tessie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Tessie requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Tessie has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramón Enrique

texts.es:
Ramón es un ejemplo de superación personal para los habitantes del barrio donde reside, tiene una limitación física en sus miembros inferiores, además vive solo pues la vida le dio un duro golpe luego del fallecimiento de su madre quien lo cuidaba y velaba por su bienestar. Con empuje y su espíritu de superación, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su vivienda, allí atiende todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, ofrece diversos productos de la canasta familiar y, aunque tiene limitaciones para moverse dentro del negocio, esto no le impide prestar un buen servicio a sus clientes, pues finalmente sus clientes lo conocen y comprenden su situación; así, ha logrado generar recursos para su sustento propio durante los últimos 8 años que lleva funcionando el establecimiento.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (granos, galletería, chocolate, café, entre otros), esto le dará la posibilidad de ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y mejorar las ventas en esta temporada de fin de año.
Ramón, a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta diariamente, se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y pujante, por ello desea seguir luchando para poder cumplir el sueño de ampliar el negocio para que sea más rentable y además desea adecuar el espacio para facilitar su movilidad dentro del establecimiento; logrando una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para si mismo.
texts.en:
Ramón is an example of personal self-development for the inhabitants of the neighborhood where he lives. He has a physical disability in his lower limbs. He has lived alone since life dealt him a hard blow with the death of his mother who had taken care of him and looked after his well being. With drive and a spirit of self-improvement he decided to start his own business, a grocery store located at his home. There he waits on customers every day from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. He provides a variety of basic supplies for the household. Although he has mobility limitations within his business, this does not stop him from providing good service to his clients. Finally, his customers know him and understand his situation. Therefore he has been successful in generating the resources to support himself for the past eight years he has run his store.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock wholesale (grains, cookies, chocolate and coffee among other items). This will give him the possibility of offering a greater inventory to his customers and improve his sales during this end of year season.

Ramón, despite the challenges that he confronts daily, is characterized as being a happy and vigorous man. Consequently, he wants to continue struggling to fulfill his dream of expanding his business so that it is more profitable and in addition he wants to upgrade the space so that he can move more easily throughout the establishment, thereby improving his quality of life and sense of well-being.

loans.use: to purchase supplies wholesale (grains, cookies, chocolate and coffee, among other items).

loans.name: Yennifer Natalia

texts.es:
Yennifer es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, que realizó cursos de belleza, químicos, corte y cepillado, manicure y pedicure, luego de graduarse decidió emprender su propio negocio y comenzó a prestar sus servicios de estilista a domicilio, así ha logrado generar los recursos con los que aporta al sostenimiento de su familia; pero, con el ánimo de generar un ingreso adicional, desea incursionar en el área comercial, vendiendo helados en la comodidad de su hogar, por ello solicita el crédito, con el que desea comprar un congelador para almacenar los helados, así mejorará los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. 
Yennifer, se proyecta en un futuro cercano, teniendo su propio salón de belleza, que le genere una buena rentabilidad para poder adquirir su casa propia y a largo plazo poder conformar una familia a la que pueda brindar un bienestar y calidad de vida adecuados.
texts.en:
Yennifer es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, que realizó cursos de belleza, químicos, corte y cepillado, manicure y pedicure, luego de graduarse decidió emprender su propio negocio y comenzó a prestar sus servicios de estilista a domicilio, así ha logrado generar los recursos con los que aporta al sostenimiento de su familia; pero, con el ánimo de generar un ingreso adicional, desea incursionar en el área comercial, vendiendo helados en la comodidad de su hogar, por ello solicita el crédito, con el que desea comprar un congelador para almacenar los helados, así mejorará los ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia. 
Yennifer, se proyecta en un futuro cercano, teniendo su propio salón de belleza, que le genere una buena rentabilidad para poder adquirir su casa propia y a largo plazo poder conformar una familia a la que pueda brindar un bienestar y calidad de vida adecuados.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to store ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 47 years old. She is married, with three children. She sells sugar and other various items in her boutique. 

With the loan, Alphonsine would like to buy more sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Annoitte

texts.en: Annoitte is 33 years old. She is married with two children and has been in the business for the past thirteen years. With this loan, she would like to buy more peanuts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 45-years-old and married with five children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell such as egg, spices, canned goods, chips, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid three loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Marivic aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as egg, spices, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Balvina Cecilia

texts.es:
Balvina  tiene 40 años de edad estado civil casado vive con el esposo  y con su hija de 5 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Balvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la situación económica. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.
texts.en:
Balvina  tiene 40 años de edad estado civil casado vive con el esposo  y con su hija de 5 años, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Balvina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la situación económica. Su sueño es  tener una casa propia.
Le gusta trabajar y dedicarse a la familia.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Mariana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mariana tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvio De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvio de los Amarillos , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, una bomba para fumigar y evitar las plagas y enfermedades, ademas alimento para los animales balanceado. 

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es tener mas ingresos para dar mejor calidad de vida y  dar lo necesario a los hijos, le gusta trabajar y descarnsar cuando tiempo tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Mariana, 33, is married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband and kids in the area of Desvio de los Amarillo in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. She is part of the lending group Pequenos Agricultores, located in the same place as where she lives. The members work in agriculture and livestock.

Mariana plants corn and raises animals like chickens and pigs. With the loan she will be able to buy inputs like fertilizers, compost, and a fumigation pump to avoid the pests and diseases. She will also buy balanced feed for the animals. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas. Her dream is to have more income to give her family a better quality of life and give her children what they need. She likes to work, and to rest when she has free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, a fumigation pump to avoid pests and diseases, as well as balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Christin Katerine

texts.es:
Christin tiene 24 años de edad estado civil Unión Libre vive con su esposo e hijo de 4 años, en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama ASOCIACIÓN MONTUBIOS VENTANILLA NORTE se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Ventanilla Norte, perteneciente al cantón ventanas, se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Christin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karlita y las vende en el mercado de ventanas.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para mejorar la actividad agrícola y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.
Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Christin is 24 years old and lives with her husband in a common-law marriage and her 4-year-old son in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  Her communal bank, Asociación Montubios Ventanilla Norte, is located in the area of Ventanilla Norte which belongs to the Ventanas canton.  The people here work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Christin has worked in agriculture planting corn and rice for some years now.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas from Agroquímica Karlita and sells her goods in the Ventanas market.  

She requested the loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers to plant corn and rice.  The loan has helped her to improve her agricultural activities and to invest.  

Her dream is to purchase land to build a house.  She likes working in agriculture.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jairo León

texts.es:
Jairo es un hombre trabajador y pujante, siempre va buscando alternativas que le permitan sacar adelante su familia y en especial a su hijo de 11 años de edad.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa y, de manera alterna montó su propio negocio de venta de comidas con el fin de complementar los ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar, pues con el salario que recibe no le alcanza. Allí ofrece alimentos fritos como empanadas, palos de queso, sánduches, pasteles y otros productos de panadería y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien le colabora mientras él cumple el horario laboral.
El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (productos de panadería, gaseosas, desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y podrá ofrecer nuevos productos que satisfagan los gustos diversos de sus clientes y mejorando así sus ventas.
Jairo manifiesta que su propósito es fortalecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable que le permita independizarse por completo y le brinde la oportunidad de compartir una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Jairo is a hard-working and strong man. He is always looking for ways to help his family prosper, particularly for his eleven-year-old son.

Jairo currently works for a business but he also has his own business selling meals in order to complement his income and cover household costs. His income from his job does not allow him to do this. Jairo offers fried foods, such as pastries, cheese sticks, sandwiches, cakes and other bakery products at his business. He receives support from his wife who helps him while he is at his job.

This loan will be used to buy stock (bread products, fizzy drinks, disposable plates, cups and cutlery and more) in bulk. This will allow Jairo to make more money with his business and he will be able to offer more products to satisfy his customers' various tastes and increase his sales.

Jairo tells us that his aim is to strengthen his business in order for it to be profitable and to give him the financial stability that will allow him to work completely independently. He wants the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life with his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy stock (breads, fizzy drinks, disposable plates, cups and cutlery and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella desea seguir participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda con el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar emprendiendo su negocio, ella continua con su actividad económica que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, pan, gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas, ella continua con la pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos a sus amigos y vecinos. 

Hilda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo panetones, champanes, galletas, tortas, dulces, leche, chocolate, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar al por mayor pues le sale a mas barato.
texts.en:
Hilda wants to thank all of her investors for the loan and is very pleased with the support provided. She want continue participating in this project because it has helped her provide the capital for her business. She is also motivated to continue launching her business, selling staple foods such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, bread, sodas, beer, and more. She is still running her small store out of her home, selling her products to friends and neighbors.

Hilda will use this loan to take advantage of an opportunity to buy merchandise such as panettones, champagne, cookies, cakes, sweets, milk, and chocolate, as well as sacks of rice and sugar, which she will be able to obtain at the less expensive wholesale prices.

loans.use: buy sacks of rice and sugar at wholesale, where she can get a better deal

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna Isabel habita en el caserío Los Limones ubicado a 5 km del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora de 39 años, madre de cuatro hijos tres de ellos a su cargo.
Doña Reyna fue criada en el campo entre medio de las vacas y cosechas de granos donde sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de campo y a ganarse la vida donde les agradece porque hoy tiene su propia vivienda y cuenta con ganado el que le permite comercializar la leche y obtener ganancias para sobrevivir.
Es un trabajo muy duro pero se siente muy orgullosa de sus raíces porque gracias al esfuerzo de los campesinos es que un país vive de la producción de leche, granos, miel, los cuales muchas veces son exportados por su buena calidad.
Doña Reyna con el fin de aumentar su hato ganadero está solicitando un crédito para la compra de tres terneros los que piensa engordar, desarrollarlos para su posterior venta con lo que le queda ganancia.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada por los inversionistas de Kiva para llevar a cabo su inversión y agradece por el apoyo incondicional que brindan a las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives in the village of Los Limones, located 5 km from the town of El Sauce. She is 39 years old and a mother of four children. Reyna was raised in the field among the cows and the grain harvests where her parents taught her to work the farm and to earn a living. She is grateful to them because now she has her own home and has cattle whose milk she can sell to earn money to survive. It is a hard job but she is proud of her roots because thanks to the efforts of the farmers, the country lives on the good quality milk, grains and honey they produce and often export.

Reyna, with the goal of increasing her herd of cattle, is asking for a loan to buy three calves to fatten, develop them and later sell them for a profit. She hopes and trusts in God that her loan will be approved by the Kiva lenders so that she can compete her investment, and thanks them for the unconditional support that they give to people of scarce resources.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de refrigerios para los distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia elabora hamburguesas, salchipapas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This responsible, hard-working member continues to focus on her business selling snacks to her various customers. Her snacks include hamburgers and salchipapas, a typical street food composed of sausage and french fries. She has quite a bit of experience in this business, and it provides her personal as well as economic satisfaction. She wants to keep working at this business so that she can continue to support her family. The member is requesting this loan so that she can purchase ingredients such as oil and rice, among other things. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: purchase ingredients like oil and rice for her snack shop

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
El socio José continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: José continues to focus on being a service provider of transportation. He has spent a fair bit of time in this business, and it's going well for him thanks to the drive that he brings to his job every day. He wants to continue working in this way so that he can continue to support his family.  José is requesting this loan so that he can buy spare parts for his vehicle. He is grateful for the support he has been granted and he is commited to paying back his loan on time.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his work vehicle

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 45 years old and married with two children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and noodles.

She has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. Beverly has been running the general store for 18 years. She also earns income from raising pigs.

Beverly aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 41 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Carina is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF)  to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for eight years and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31-years-old and married with one child.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from Kiva partner NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Analyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase stock to sell such as spices, canned goods, chips, bread, etc. for her general store business.

Celia has been in this business for four years. Celia earns additional income from farming rice.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock to such as spices, canned goods, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Mariefa

texts.en:
Mariefa is 37-years-old, single and works hard to support her parents to increase the family income.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Mariefa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grain business.

Mariefa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Santo

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 47 años de edad de estado civil Union Libre tiene tres hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Recinto Desvio De los Amarillo perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla PEQUEÑOS AGRICULTORES se encuentra ubicada el  recinto Desvio de los Amarillos , perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
